meanings.definition: In a slow or laborious manner
meanings.sent1: She walked draggingly to the finish line, her tired feet barely moving.
meanings.sent2: The old man moved draggingly across the room, leaning heavily on his cane.
meanings.sent3: The snail moved draggingly, causing the other animals to chuckle at its slow pace.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to pass draggingly as she waited for the test results, each minute feeling like an hour.
meanings.sent5: The heavy backpack made her walk draggingly up the steep hill, each step a struggle.

meanings.definition: Moving or progressing with difficulty or resistance
meanings.sent1: The car made a draggingly slow progress up the muddy hill, its wheels slipping.
meanings.sent2: The injured dog limped draggingly back to its owner, unable to put weight on its paw.
meanings.sent3: The draggingly heavy door refused to budge, much to the frustration of the people waiting outside.
meanings.sent4: His draggingly slow recovery from the illness felt like a never-ending battle against weakness.
meanings.sent5: The draggingly long line at the amusement park made the children impatient and restless.
